translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about the Giver of the World
The Elder Jātipupphi’s Birth Story
“When the Fortunate One,
the great golden one with the lotus eyes, had attained Final Emancipation;
I made a garland of flowers,
and placed it on his body.
Having had faith in that place,🔽I went to the Divine Realm;
Having gone to the World of the Gods,

analyzed: puñña kammam sarāmaha  ambarā puppha vassaḥ me
translated: I remembered my meritorious deed.🔽A rain of cloth and flowers
rains down on me at all times;
If I wander among humans,
I become a king of great fame.
There a rain of flowers
rains down on me all the time;
Because of that flower worship,
I have seen the One with Vision.
This is my last birth,
my last existence is being lived out;
Even today a rain of flowers
rains down on me all the time.
For a hundred thousand cycles of time,
I placed a flower on (the Buddha’s body);
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the body.
My defilements have been burnt up,
I live without pollutants.
How welcome it was for me,
…🔽I have done the Teacher’s work.🔽…
The four discriminations,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā jātipupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā jātipupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Teacher’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Jātipupphiya recited these verses.
The Story of Elder Jātipupphiya is the eighth.
